result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Lois Hansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early discharge at recommendation of agent if obligations fulfilled.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
No violent or abusive contact with the Victim.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather Lois Hansen

records.addlTxt:
09:40 AM Defendant Heather Lois Hansen in court with attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe.  Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared for the Wisconsin, State of.
  All appearances by phone.  Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. Report states def is competent, all parties agree with Dr. findings. NC plea entered Count 1. Def makes statement to the Court.
Plea hearing on March 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Atty LaCombe requesting globalization in Branch 2
Plea hearing on April 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:12 AM Defendant Heather Lois Hansen in court with attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the Wisconsin, State of.
  950/Marsy's Law complied with. Report shows def is now competent to proceed with this case. 30 day adjournment requested.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:03 AM Defendant Heather Lois Hansen not in court.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the Wisconsin, State of.
Case recalled at 09:43 AM Defendant Heather Lois Hansen in court with attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the Wisconsin, State of.
  All appearances by phone. Court explains to Atty LaCombe in the future to contact her bailiff instead of her Judicial Asst because her assistant is not in chambers like other judges.
Atty LaCombe has not reviewed Competency Evaluation w/client but fine proceeding today/rpt came back as they thought it would. State not comfortable going forward today. Court sets new Competency hearing.
Court fine with taking up bond today if the State is. State prepared to hear bond. 950 complied with. Atty LaCombe argues bond to have No Violent or Abusive contact, starting today client in treatment at Labor of Love, ERD completed by husband. State has concerns about deft not following bond conditions for all the reasons stated on the record.  Court denies bond motion requested by Defense.
Competency hearing on March 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter to Judge from Attorney LaCombe Re Second Motion to Modify Bond
Bail/bond hearing on March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Second Motion to modify bond
for Competency Examination by DHS

4:23 PM Defendant Heather Lois Hansen appeared by phone with attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe.  Daniel j Gabler appeared by phone for the Wisconsin, State of.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Witness on phone. 
Attorney LaCombe raises compentency, request competency evaluation. Court finds probable cause and orders a competency evaluation. 
Defense request bond modification, wants contact with witness. Court will not change bond conditions right now, denies motion. Court will also not take up state's motion regarding bond due to competency being raised.  
Competency hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Day Report dated 1-24-22
based on day reporting performance
Day Report dated 01/13/2022
Bail/bond hearing on February 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
